name: Number theory
description: Number theory is a branch of pure mathematics devoted primarily to the study of the integers.

subfields.name: Elementary number theory
subfields.description: Elementary number theory is the study of the natural numbers and their properties.

subfields.name: Analytic number theory
subfields.description: Analytic number theory is the study of the integers by means of tools from real and complex analysis.

subfields.name: Algebraic number theory
subfields.description: Algebraic number theory is the study of the integers and their properties using methods from algebra.

subfields.name: Diophantine geometry
subfields.description: Diophantine geometry is the study of the integers and their properties using methods from geometry.

name: Geometry
description: Geometry is a branch of mathematics concerned with questions of shape, size, relative position of figures, and the properties of space.

subfields.name: Projective geometry
subfields.description: Projective geometry is the study of the properties of points, lines, and planes in a projective space.

subfields.name: Affine geometry
subfields.description: Affine geometry is the study of properties relative to parallelism and independent from the concept of length.

subfields.name: Differential geometry
subfields.description: Differential geometry is the study of curves, surfaces, and their generalizations, which are defined using differentiable functions.

subfields.name: Manifold theory
subfields.description: Manifold theory is the study of shapes that are not necessarily embedded in a larger space.

subfields.name: Riemannian geometry
subfields.description: Riemannian geometry is the study of distance properties in curved spaces.

subfields.name: Algebraic geometry
subfields.description: Algebraic geometry is the study of curves, surfaces, and their generalizations, which are defined using polynomials.

subfields.name: Topology
subfields.description: Topology is the study of properties that are kept under continuous deformations.

subfields.name: Algebraic topology
subfields.description: Algebraic topology is the use in topology of algebraic methods, mainly homological algebra.

subfields.name: Discrete geometry
subfields.description: Discrete geometry is the study of finite configurations in geometry.

subfields.name: Convex geometry
subfields.description: Convex geometry is the study of convex sets, which takes its importance from its applications in optimization.

subfields.name: Complex geometry
subfields.description: Complex geometry is the geometry obtained by replacing real numbers with complex numbers.

subfields.name: Algebra
subfields.description: Algebra is the branch of mathematics in which letters and other general symbols are used to represent numbers and quantities, while maintaining the properties of operations.

subfields.name: Group theory
subfields.description: Group theory is the study of groups, which are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with an operation that combines any two elements to form a third.

subfields.name: Field theory
subfields.description: Field theory is the study of fields, which are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.

subfields.name: Vector spaces
subfields.description: Vector spaces are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.

subfields.name: Ring theory
subfields.description: Ring theory is the study of rings, which are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.

subfields.name: Commutative algebra
subfields.description: Commutative algebra is the study of commutative rings, which are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.

subfields.name: Homological algebra
subfields.description: Homological algebra is the study of algebraic structures that are used to study the homology and cohomology of topological spaces.

subfields.name: Lie algebra and Lie group theory
subfields.description: Lie algebra and Lie group theory is the study of Lie algebras and Lie groups, which are algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.

subfields.name: Boolean algebra
subfields.description: Boolean algebra is the study of algebraic structures consisting of a set of elements together with two operations that combine any two elements to form a third, and which satisfy certain properties.
